public class MessageController
extends java.lang.Object

      • saveMessage

        @PostMapping("/msg")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Message> saveMessage​(@RequestBody
                                                                    Message Message)
        REST END point that will save the messages to the local repository
        Parameters:
        Message - takes in a message to be saved to the Message repository
        Returns:
        RESPONSE entitiy ok that you have sucessfully saved a message fails with error 404 if this post mapping fails

      • getAllMessages

        @GetMapping("/msg")
public java.util.List<Message> getAllMessages()
        REST END POitn that will tell us all of our current messages that is saved to the repository
        Returns:
        all of the messages that is saved in our repository fails with 404 error if this get mapping fails and cant be found

      • newMessage

        @PostMapping("/send/new")
public Message newMessage​(@RequestBody
                          int senderId,
                          int recipientId,
                          java.lang.String message)
        This will create a Message from scratch and saved to the repository
        Parameters:
        senderId - takes in a senderId that is associated with the message
        recipientIdtakes - in a recipientId that is associated with the message
        message - takes in a message that will be saved to the message repository
        Returns:
        the new message with the contructed fields throws a 404 error if this post mapping fails

      • getUserById

        @GetMapping(path="/getMessageById/{id}")
public Message getUserById​(@PathVariable
                           int id)
        This will return a message that is assiociatted with the corresponding id that is passed into it
        Parameters:
        id - id that will tell us which message that we are wanting to return
        Returns:
        the message with the correct id from the local repository this get mapping will throw a 404 error if it is not able to be found

      • updateMessage

        @PutMapping("/msg/update/{id}")
public Message updateMessage​(@PathVariable
                             int id,
                             @RequestBody
                             Message Message)
        update the message by id from the local repository
        Parameters:
        id - will let us know what message we are trying to update by the corresponding id that is passed into the method
        Message - will return the updated message and save it to the repository
        Returns:
        will return the updated message this method will throw a 404 error if this mapping is not found
